div.p: The PustefixEditor is a project browser and editor shipped with . It allows you to browse the structure of targets, pages and include parts of the projects in your environment. Additionally you can create images and include parts and edit them.
Note: The source code of the Editor is not a good example for writing applications with pustefix. For example see the sample application in the CVS checkout.
First we will have a closer look at the Sample Application.

tr.td: In the red box you see the EditConsole divided into three different sections. Press the button with the pen symbol showing the ToolTip Switch edit mode ON in section No. 1. Now, the application will look like as follows.

Note: The button Section No. 1 only works if you declared the editmode property here as true. Alternatively you can switch to EditMode by appending __editmode=admin to the URL. Section No. 3 is only visible if you have declared a record_dir here. Also have a look at the TestClient documentation.

No the application is in EditMode. In EditMode every include part is framed by red curly braces. Remember that include parts can be nested. After each closing curly brace there is a small box with a pen symbol in it. Staying with to mouse over it shows the ToolTip 'Edit include: ...'. Pressing this box opens the Editor in a new window starting with the login page. After successful login the include is automatically opened in the includes page.
